As far as I can tell, the RNG is not seeded here and the tested value is random. My back of the envelope calculation would have this test failing very frequently. If I put setSeed(7); right below the line SECTION("dropout") {, I get the same result (106 in my particular case) every time.

I don't know Catch2 well enough to say if there is a way to have each SECTION automatically initialize the RNG (at the TEST_CASE level one might work with fixtures).

body:
As far as I can tell, the RNG is not seeded here and the tested value is random. My back of the envelope calculation would have this test failing very frequently. If I put `setSeed(7);` right below the line [`SECTION("dropout") {`](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/54a48676751c28c5d355e7114b17e8942b28c721/test/cpp/api/container.cpp#L209), I get the same result (106 in my particular case) every time.

I don't know Catch2 well enough to say if there is a way to have each SECTION automatically initialize the RNG (at the TEST_CASE level one might work with fixtures).
